page.title: 01MARTON & NUNTHORPE
page.content: Our D block can be conveniently divided into an area of suburban housing covering the N.E. part of the block and agricultural land covering the rest (see 'land cover' survey). The suburban area comprises the villages of{Marton}and{Nunthorpe.}Both villages are of early origin. Marton is also well known as the birthplace of Captain James Cook. Little evidence is left of the past and most of the housing is recent. The villages serve as a dormitory area for nearby {Middlesbrough.}The area is crossed by roads and a railway, and well served by schools such as Captain Cook Junior, Chandler's Ridge Primary, St Bernadette's Primary and Nunthorpe Primary - the schools contributing the following chapters. A big THANK-YOU to all the children and staff involved.
